snippet: Mass graves have been found in southern Mexico, and some fear they could contain the bodies of 43 students missing since deadly clashes with the police on Sept. 26.
abstract: Mass graves have been found in southern Mexico, and some fear they could contain bodies of 43 students missing since deadly clashes with police, who prosecutors say were linked to local gang; case is generating alarm, both for possible involvement of police and for fact that students were not known to have criminal ties.

byline.contributor: Paulina Villegas contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Mass graves have been found in southern Mexico, and some fear they could contain the bodies of 43 students missing since deadly clashes with the police on Sept. 26.

headline.main: 43 Missing Students, a Mass Grave and a Suspect: Mexico’s Police
headline.print_headline: 43 Missing Students, a Mass Grave and a Suspect: Mexico’s Police

keywords.value: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
keywords.name: organizations
